name: Pancakes
instructions: Mix flour, milk, egg, sugar, and melted butter in a bowl.
Heat a pan over medium heat and lightly grease it with butter.
Pour batter into the pan and cook until bubbles form on the surface.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve with maple syrup or your favorite toppings.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: Chop romaine lettuce and place in a large bowl.
Add grated parmesan cheese and croutons.
Pour Caesar dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato sauce and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 15 minutes, then serve over the cooked spaghetti.

name: Chicken Curry
instructions: Sauté chopped onion and garlic in a pan with a bit of oil.
Add diced chicken breasts and cook until browned.
Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
Add coconut milk and simmer until chicken is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve with rice.

name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan or wok over high heat.
Add sliced vegetables and stir-fry for a few minutes until tender-crisp.
Add minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry for another minute.
Add soy sauce and toss to coat the vegetables.
Serve over rice or noodles.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually mix into the butter mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto a baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned.
Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning to the beef.
Cook according to seasoning package instructions.
Fill taco shells with seasoned beef.
Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomato, cheese, and sour cream.

name: Margarita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface and transfer to a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
Sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted and bubbly.
Top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil before serving.

name: Greek Salad
instructions: Chop cucumber, tomato, and red onion and place in a bowl.
Add kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Sauté chopped onion, carrot, and celery in a pot with a bit of oil until softened.
Add minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until lentils are tender.
Serve hot.

name: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Peel, core, and slice apples, then toss with sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and a bit of flour.
Place the mixture into the pie crust.
Dot with butter and cover with a second pie crust or lattice top.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until crust is golden and filling is bubbly.
Cool before serving.
